阿图尔·杜兰 (Artur Duran) 伸出手放在腰间，展示他记忆中的两年前西班牙东北部达尼厄斯·博阿德拉 (Darnius Boadella) 水库的水位。

然后，它仍然足够深，可以航行。现在，长期干旱几乎将其耗尽。

“我们从来没有见过这么低的水位，”这位 79 岁的当地居民在水库里告诉路透社，水库的蓄水量只有 20%。

人们在水库新露出的岸边晒日光浴，那里已经长出了一些小草。一些游客尝试划桨冲浪。

加泰罗尼亚当局上周对靠近法国边境的水库周围的 22 个村庄实施了新的用水限制，因为向这些村庄供水的含水层也正在枯竭。

2023 年前四个月，西班牙迎来了自 1960 年代有记录以来最干旱的一年，其中加泰罗尼亚和西班牙南部的安达卢西亚受影响最严重。

西班牙气象机构AEMET发言人鲁本·德尔·坎波(Ruben del Campo)表示，今年夏天西班牙和整个欧洲发生的几场热浪加剧了干旱，随着水蒸发和消耗量的增加，水库水位降低。

这22个村庄，加上加泰罗尼亚南部的另外两个村庄，共有约25,000名居民，目前正处于缺水紧急状态。

这意味着他们必须将每位居民的日均用水量从之前的 230 升降至 200 升。当局尚未限制人类用水，但农业用水将被禁止，工业用水将被禁止。娱乐目的必须下降 25%。

拥有 900 名居民的 Agullana 村几个月来一直将用水量控制在 200 升以下，但村长表示将采取进一步措施。

何塞普·乔维尔说：“我们将把花园、足球场、游泳池边的草坪的灌溉量减少到零，我们会看到它们变黄，就像被烧焦一样。”他补充说，不会用水来清洁街道，只会干扫。

英国选举委员会周二表示，它已成为去年 10 月首次发现的复杂网络事件的目标，该事件涉及其系统被“敌对行为者”访问。

选举委员会是监督英国选举和管理政治财政的独立机构。

该公司在社交媒体平台 X 上发布的一系列帖子中表示：“敌对行为者在我们的系统中很活跃，并且可以访问保存我们电子邮件、控制系统和选举登记册副本的服务器。”

该委员会补充说，登记册中的大部分数据——包括 2014 年至 2022 年期间登记投票者的姓名和地址以及海外选民的姓名——已经属于公共领域。

该委员会表示，该委员会已与英国国家网络安全中心和外部专家合作调查该事件，并已对其 IT 系统的安全性进行了改进。

教皇方济各周二呼吁全球反思人工智能（AI）的潜在危险，并指出新技术的“破坏性可能性和矛盾的影响”。

现年 86 岁的方济各过去曾表示自己不会使用电脑，他在下一个天主教会世界和平日（即元旦）的消息中发出了这一警告。

按照惯例，梵蒂冈提前很早就发布了这一消息。

教宗“回顾需要保持警惕并努力工作，以便暴力和歧视的逻辑不会在此类设备的生产和使用中扎根，从而以最脆弱和最受排斥的群体为代价”，信中写道。

“迫切需要以负责任的方式引导人工智能的概念和使用，以便它可以为人类服务并保护我们共同的家园，这要求将道德反思扩展到教育和法律领域， ”它补充道。

早在2015年，弗朗西斯就承认技术是“一场灾难”，但他也称互联网、社交网络和短信是“上帝的礼物”，前提是它们被明智地使用。

2020年，梵蒂冈与科技巨头微软（MSFT.O）和IBM （IBM.N） 联手，推动人工智能的道德发展，并呼吁对面部识别等侵入性技术进行监管。

  • 立法者和大学批评这一决定是种族主义

以色列财政部长贝扎雷尔·斯莫特里奇以犯罪和安全担忧为由，冻结了东耶路撒冷阿拉伯城镇和巴勒斯坦教育项目的资金，并引发了种族主义指控。

总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡领导的民族主义宗教政府的重要成员斯莫特里奇周一表示，用于阿拉伯地方议会的一些预算资金是前任内阁的政治回报，最终可能落入“犯罪分子和恐怖分子手中”。 ”。

支持定居者的宗教犹太复国主义党魁斯莫特里奇表示：“我们国家政府的优先事项……与前左翼政府不同，我们不应该为此道歉。”斯莫特里奇过去有关巴勒斯坦人的言论引起了国际社会的谴责。

以色列公共广播公司 Kan 于周日首次报道了冻结情况，当时它发表了内政部长摩西·阿贝尔 (Moshe Arbel) 写给斯莫特里奇的一封信，敦促他释放 2 亿谢克尔（5,400 万美元）的资金，用于行政管理，另外 1 亿用于经济。发展。

阿拉伯联合名单主席、议员曼苏尔·阿巴斯指责斯莫特里奇有种族主义行为。

“阿拉伯公民有权获得这些资金，这些资金旨在缩小阿拉伯和犹太社区之间的差距，”他告诉路透社。

阿拉伯公民约占以色列人口的五分之一，其中大多数是巴勒斯坦人的后裔，他们在 1948 年以色列建国战争结束后留在新的以色列国。

内塔尼亚胡办公室没有回应置评请求，而反对派领导人、前总理亚伊尔·拉皮德也指责斯莫特里奇存在种族主义，“仅仅因为阿拉伯公民是阿拉伯人就虐待他们”。

几十年来，与犹太公民相比，以色列的阿拉伯少数民族一直面临着社会和经济差距，包括贫困率高、基础设施匮乏的城镇过度拥挤以及学校资金匮乏。

以色列阿拉伯地方议会全国委员会主席阿米尔·比沙拉特 (Ameer Bisharat) 表示，这些额外资金将于 2022 年指定给 67 个阿拉伯议会，这是该国承认多年来向阿拉伯地方分配资源不足的情况。

他说，冻结可能意味着议会无法提供垃圾收集或暑假后重新开放学校等基本服务。

“仇恨和种族主义”

斯莫特里奇表示，用于鼓励东耶路撒冷巴勒斯坦人学术研究的另外2亿谢克尔也将被冻结，直到他所说的校园内的“极端伊斯兰活动”被根除。

今年 5 月，政府延长了 2018 年 21 亿谢克尔的五年计划，旨在改善东耶路撒冷的教育、就业、卫生和基础设施。以色列在 1967 年的战争中占领了东耶路撒冷，并以未得到国际承认的举动将其吞并。

它包括帮助巴勒斯坦人融入以色列学术机构的计划，巴勒斯坦人占耶路撒冷人口的近 40%，其中近三分之二生活在贫困线以下。

斯莫特里奇表示，新的东耶路撒冷计划将增加预算总额，但尽管鼓励该市巴勒斯坦人进行学术研究是一个值得的事业，但这也会带来不受欢迎的后果。

他在脸书上回应菅直人的报告时说：“近年来，激进的伊斯兰组织在以色列的大学和学院中发展起来，他们一次又一次地表达了与以色列敌人的团结。”

目前尚不清楚斯莫特里奇的激进主张基于哪些数据或研究，但他引用了 2021 年以色列-加沙战争期间亲巴勒斯坦学生的抗议活动。相关学术机构驳回了他的说法。

耶路撒冷希伯来大学和其他三所机构对斯莫特里奇的资助决定表示震惊，该决定将影响数百名巴勒斯坦学生，并敦促内塔尼亚胡不要让“宣扬仇恨和种族主义的声音”占上风。

该大学补充说，安全负责人已明确表示，斯莫特里奇的决定将适得其反。

台积电 (TSMC) (2330.TW)周二表示，其董事会已批准投资 35 亿欧元（38 亿美元），在德国建设其第一家欧洲工厂。

全球最大的代工芯片制造商台积电自 2021 年以来一直在与德国萨克森州就在德累斯顿建设一家制造厂（或“fab”）进行谈判。

该公司在董事会会议后的一份简短声明中表示，已批准向台积电控股的德国子公司欧洲半导体制造公司（ESMC）有限公司投资高达34.99亿欧元，以提供代工服务。

欧盟已批准《欧盟芯片法案》，这是一项430亿欧元的补贴计划，旨在到2030年将其芯片制造能力提高一倍，以赶上亚洲和美国。

台积电是包括英特尔(INTC.O)和 Wolfspeed (WOLF.N)在内的几家寻求利用政府资金在欧洲建厂的芯片制造商之一。

该集团力求到 2030 年将其全球市场份额翻一番，达到 20%。

台积电还投资 400 亿美元在美国西部亚利桑那州建造一座新工厂，支持华盛顿在国内生产更多芯片的计划。

台积电在董事会会议后的声明中表示，还批准向亚利桑那工厂注资不超过45亿美元，作为总投资400亿美元的一部分。

Three years in exile, Belarus opposition divided about path

33 岁的帕维尔·马耶斯基 (Pavel Maryeuski) 是一位致力于和平政治的活动家，三年前选举后，总统亚历山大·卢卡申科 (Alexander Lukashenko) 镇压抗议活动后，他逃离祖国白俄罗斯，从未持有武器。

去年，当俄罗斯入侵乌克兰时，他感受到了战斗的召唤，加入了白俄罗斯志愿部队，在前线支援乌克兰。

“起初我想到了乌克兰、乌克兰人以及保护生命，”他在波兰告诉路透社。 “然后我想到了白俄罗斯。”

如果俄罗斯输了，白俄罗斯也可能发生变化。他的乌克兰冲突老兵同胞也必将在为自己的国家而战中发挥作用。

“我认为这是我们白俄罗斯人返回家园的机会。”

在选举三周年纪念日之际，她的追随者认为她获胜了，40 岁的白俄罗斯反对派领导人斯维亚特兰娜·齐哈努斯卡娅 (Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya) 具备了候任领导人的所有特征：流亡内阁、外交任务、与西方政要定期会面。

由于几乎所有反对派现在都入狱或流亡，这绝非易事。反对派多种多样且分散，在过去三年中估计逃离该国的 10 万人中可能有几千人，其政治立场从自由主义到民族主义不一而足。

愤怒团结

如果返回白俄罗斯，许多人将因缺席刑事指控而面临长期监禁。路透社在引发镇压的选举三年后采访了 20 多名反对派人士，以了解他们的情绪。大多数人认为没有什么办法能够快速战胜一位执政近30年的领导人。

他们在策略上存在分歧，但他们对卢卡申科的持续统治、他监禁和折磨数千名反对者以及他与俄罗斯的密切联盟的愤怒而团结在一起，他们认为这否定了白俄罗斯的主权。

齐哈努斯卡娅上周在立陶宛接受路透社采访时表示：“我们成功地维持了民主力量的团结并对其进行了重组，即创建新的机构并维持政治行为体和公民倡议之间的合作。”

她甚至仍然希望有一天能够与仍在明斯克政府服务的官员展开对话：“也许他们中的一些人会有足够的常识，并且会明白卢卡申科不会带领白俄罗斯走向任何地方，他正在出卖我们的主权，”她说。

斯坦尼斯拉瓦·格林尼克 (Stanislava Glinnik) 的祖父是白俄罗斯后苏联时代第一位国家元首，直到 1994 年在最后一次竞争性选举中输给了卢卡申科。现在，斯坦尼斯拉瓦·格林尼克 (Stanislava Glinnik) 是民间社会团体网络协调委员会的成员。

“这不再是反对派，而是真正的流亡政府，”她坐在华沙的一家酒吧 Karma 告诉路透社，该酒吧曾经位于明斯克。

反对派团体目前为海外白俄罗斯人设立了 20 多个替代大使馆、领事馆或信息中心，并管理着至少两个情报机构，试图影响白俄罗斯境内的事件。

活动人士帮助白俄罗斯人逃往国外，黑客正在开发允许白俄罗斯境内安全通信的应用程序，一些组织追踪该国军队的位置。

但一小部分积极分子（其中许多人在乌克兰有战斗经验）表示，现在是为真正的战斗进行训练的时候了，但人数仍在不断增加。

上周在波兰举行的一次会议上，最热烈的掌声颁给了曾在乌克兰作战的老兵帕维尔·库赫塔(Pavel Kuhta)，他发表了激烈的演讲，谴责齐哈努斯卡娅流亡内阁成员在组织武装抵抗方面没有采取足够的行动。

47 岁的谢尔盖·凯德什科 (Sergey Kedyshko) 率领约 200 名白俄罗斯志愿者在波兰和立陶宛进行战斗训练，他同意反对派需要增强战斗力的前提。

他说：“当发生某种军事行动时，当需要非常迅速和有效地采取行动时，白俄罗斯反对派总是落后，所以我们正在失败。”

六周前，当俄罗斯瓦格纳雇佣军组织在俄罗斯境内发动叛乱时，白俄罗斯反对派曾一度燃起短暂的希望。

在起义最激烈的时候，随着瓦格纳战士向莫斯科发起进攻，齐哈努斯卡娅在推特上表示，她正在“建立一个联合行动总部”，以“在这个关键时刻协调我们的活动”。

她说，由于卢卡申科的克里姆林宫赞助商面临危险，他突然变得比以往任何时候都更虚弱。

但数小时内，卢卡申科亲自帮助结束了俄罗斯叛变，并就瓦格纳战士转移到白俄罗斯进行了谈判。几周后，数百名身经百战的战士抵达。反对派的乐观情绪很快就破灭了。

克德什科表示，瓦格纳战士究竟将在白俄罗斯扮演什么角色，谁都说不准，但对于反对派来说，这不会带来任何好处。

“情况正在变得更糟。”

42 岁的 Vacharaesorn Vivacharawongse 出访之际，泰国王室正处于一个充满忧虑的时刻，君主的长女自去年 12 月以来一直处于昏迷状态。

European gas traders have begun storing natural gas in Ukraine to take advantage of lower prices and available capacity there, regardless of the risks from the ongoing war, three traders and company officials said.

Following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, begun in February last year, the European Union (EU) has sought high levels of gas storage to compensate for reduced Russian supply, especially during the peak demand winter months.

The bloc is expected to reach a target of filling its storage facilities to 90% full by Nov. 1.

Traders said there was commercial logic in storage in Ukraine, in addition to on EU soil, to take advantage of cheaper prices now versus for future delivery.

Gas for September delivery is priced at 30 euros ($32.96) per MWh compared with forward prices for first quarter of 2004 at 49 euros, according to prices from the TTF Dutch gas futures market.

Czech EPH group told Reuters its decision to use Ukrainian storage was also a sign of confidence in the country.

"EP Commodities transports natural gas to Ukraine and uses Ukrainian gas storage facilities," Miroslav Hasko, chairman at EPH's EP Commodities, said.

"We believe in the reliability of the Ukraine's gas transport and storage systems, which proved themselves even in such an immensely difficult wartime situation."

He did not disclose volumes.

EU countries' gas storage facilities were 87% full on Aug. 7, according to transparency platform GIE.

"We see a positive trend in gas injection by foreign traders into our (storage) facilities," said Ukriane's state-owned Ukrtransgas, part of Naftogaz Group.

Naftotgaz said foreign customers could use more than 10 billion cubic metres (bcm) of storage of the country's around 30 bcm capacity, mostly in the country's west, which is far from the front lines.

Slovakia state-owned SPP, which supplies most of the Slovak market, in part with Russian gas, said it was looking at the possibility of using Ukrainian storage given Slovak storage was already 90% full.

"We consider gas storage in Ukraine as one of the interesting business opportunities that we are currently considering," SPP told Reuters.

Other European traders said there are risks due to possible military strikes or questions over what happens to the network if Russia stops pumping the gas it still sends westward via Ukraine.

"Imagine a well-targeted missile hits a compressor station or some other infrastructure. You have to take that risk," said Martin Pich, head of trading at Czech firm MND.

The Bruegel think tank said last month Ukraine could increase Europe's storage capacity by about 10%.

"Utilising the extra 100 TWh capacity available in Ukraine will provide a nice boost to Europe's winter outlook, and a welcome boost to Ukraine's income," Bruegel said.

Gas for storage in Ukraine can be purchased anywhere and pumped using real or virtual flows in pipelines from Hungary, Poland and Slovakia.

Nominations have risen for the pipeline that transports Russian gas from Ukraine to Slovakia at the Velke Kapusany border for flows into Ukraine - virtual reverse flows. They have been up to 10 mcm per day since July.

Sea ice in the Antarctic region has fallen to a record low this year as a result of rising global temperatures and there is no quick fix to reverse the damage done, scientists said on Tuesday in a new study of the impact of climate change on the continent.

The continent's minimum summer ice cover, which last year dipped below 2 million square kilometres (772,000 square miles) for the first time since satellite monitoring began in 1978, fell further to a new low in February, according to a study published in the journal Frontiers in Environmental Science.

"It's going to take decades if not centuries for these things to recover. There's no quick fix to replacing this ice," said Caroline Holmes, polar climate scientist at British Antarctic Survey and one of the study's co-authors.

"It will certainly take a long time, even if it's possible," she told a briefing with journalists.

This year's sea ice minimum is 20% lower than the average over the last 40 years, equivalent to a sea ice loss nearly 10 times the area of New Zealand, said Tim Naish, director of the Antarctic Research Centre at Australia's Victoria University of Wellington, who was not a participant in the study.

"In some cases we are getting close to tipping points, which once crossed will lead to irreversible changes with unstoppable consequences for future generations," Naish said.

Global warming driven by the burning of fossil fuels has made Antarctica more vulnerable to extreme events and the impact is "virtually certain" to get worse, the study said.

Climate change will "lead to increases in the size and frequency" of heatwaves, ice shelf collapses and declines in sea ice, it said, drawing on recent evidence from scientific studies of the Antarctic ocean, atmosphere, cryosphere and biosphere.

The precise impact of climate change on Antarctica and the surrounding ocean has been uncertain and scientists have struggled to measure how much global warming is affecting the thickness of Antarctic ice.

But from phenomena such as the rapid decline in sea ice, it is "scientifically reasonable" to assume that extreme events are going to intensify as global temperatures rise, said Martin Siegert, a glaciologist at the University of Exeter and another co-author.

Last year, an "atmospheric river" originating from Australia drove subtropical heat and moisture into the continent, causing unprecedented temperatures up to 38.5 Celsius (69.3 Fahrenheit) above normal, the largest variance from the norm the world has ever experienced.

Siegert described the temperature increase as "absolutely astonishing", adding that if it had occurred during the Antarctic summer, instead of winter, it would have triggered melting on the surface of the East Antarctic ice sheet, which has so far been spared from melting.

"Antarctica is fragile as an environment, but extreme events test that fragility," he said. "What we're deeply concerned about is the increase in intensity and frequency of extreme events and the cascading influences that they have in other areas."

Russia's lack of ships and Western grain traders' shrinking appetite for business with Moscow are adding to rising costs of moving Russian wheat, at a time when the war in Ukraine has spilled perilously close to vital Black Sea supply routes.

President Vladimir Putin promised to replace Ukrainian grain with Russian shipments to Africa after Moscow in July ended an arrangement that gave Ukraine's food cargo safe passage in the Black Sea, imposing a de-facto blockade on its neighbour and attacking storage facilities , in an escalation of the war.

Ukraine's response, sea-drone attacks on a Russian oil tanker and a warship at its Novorossiysk naval base, next door to a major grain and oil port, has added to these new dangers for transport in the Black Sea.

Even though agriculture exports are not subject to direct European and US sanctions imposed after Russia invaded Ukraine last year, Moscow says restrictions placed on banking and Russian individuals are "hidden sanctions" on the food trade.

The financial and security risks associated with trading with Russia - compounded by the Black Sea corridor collapse - are driving up costs of freight for Moscow and pushing it toward older and smaller vessels run by less established shipping operators, Reuters reporting based on conversations with 10 marine insurers, traders and shipping companies showed.

The situation is raising doubts about whether Russia can keep up a record pace of exports and if not resolved could push global wheat prices higher, the sources said.

Already, prior to the expiry of the deal, grain carriers and commodity houses had reduced exposure to Russia.

Global commodity houses are no longer helping Russia with the mechanics of trading its grain. Cargill, Louis Dreyfus and Viterra stopped such work on July 1, adding more pressure on Moscow to handle all aspects of grain deals including transport.

Cargill has said it would continue to ship grain from Russia's ports. It declined further comment.

Dreyfus, Viterra and ADM declined to comment, while another major international group, Bunge, did not respond to a request for comment.

The data does not show how many of the requests were fulfilled, or which ship operators were involved.

The requests for ships were up 40% from June, and are likely to climb further as the export season gathers pace.

Denmark's NORDEN and two other Western shipping groups that declined to be named told Reuters they stopped working with Russia after the invasion of Ukraine in February, 2022.

INSURANCE

Without the Black Sea corridor in place, both Russia and Ukraine warned in July that ships destined for each others ports could be treated as legitimate military targets, which three marine insurance source said was a further blow to Western companies' risk appetite.

Insurance for ships heading to Russia's Black Sea ports currently costs tens of thousands of dollars in additional premiums daily, the three sources said, with rates ticking higher following Russia's attacks on Ukraine's other waterways through the Danube in recent days and Kyiv's response.

The Black Sea remains a critical area for Russian exports, with other locations more complicated and costly.

One shipping source familiar with the matter said even before insurance, ship operators were charging up to $10,000 more daily for Russian cargoes than for cargoes leaving nearby ports in Bulgaria and Romania, as the collapse of the deal and Black Sea escalation weighed.

Mike Salthouse, head of external affairs with leading ship insurer NorthStandard, said that ever since the United States and Europe imposed sanctions, some traders and insurers fear the ultimate beneficial owners of Russia's ports and terminals could be connected to designated individuals.

"The ownership structure is not readily apparent from routine or even enhanced due diligence," he said, leading to "a level of reluctance with engaging in Russian trades."

The industry executive said another risk was if a vessel needed to buy fuel from Russia, a situation the source said could create problems with Western sanctions enforcers, making it harder to then conduct non-Russian business.

"It's not easy to flip into the normal trade after that", the executive said.

Russia's Black Sea terminals handle about 70% of the country's grain exports. They include the Novorossiisk and Taman ports.

"TRADE BARRIERS"

Despite the tensions, global wheat prices remain well below the peak after Russia's invasion last year triggered fears of a global hunger crisis. The removal of more Ukrainian grain from the world market could add to supply pressure unless Russian exports or large crops from other producers make up the difference.

Two sources said the escalation of tensions in the Black Sea was likely to impact Russia's export numbers, and was discouraging shipping companies from bringing vessels to Russian ports, especially newer ships that carry more.

In a statement to Reuters, Russia's agriculture ministry forecast grain exports will fall about 8% during the 2023/24 season from Russian last year's high of 60 million tonnes. It did not give a reason for the drop.

Wheat exports will be down a little less, to 44-45 million tons, Zernin said, in line with estimates from the International Grains Council.

SHIP BUILDING

The ministry in December announced a plan to build a fleet of 61 new grain ships, citing "sanctions pressure and the refusal of many international carriers to cooperate with Russia".

Russian exporters need 34 grains ships with a carrying capacity of 60,000 tonnes and 27 with capacity of 40,000 tonnes, the ministry said in December. It did not say when they could be built by Russian shipyards.

Russia's state-owned agricultural leasing company Rosagroleasing said in March of this year it had placed orders for a fleet of grains ships that it planned to launch within three years.

No orders have currently been reported for Russian companies either domestically or internationally, according to data from valuation company VesselsValue. New ships typically take up to three years to build.

Many of the Russian operated current fleet of 31 mainly smaller dry bulk carriers are over 30 years old, VesselsValue data showed, making it harder to access some ports with stringent requirements for ships over a certain age.

"We don't see Russia building its own fleet from scratch in the short term in order to meet its immediate needs. The primary focus is going be on chartering from the commercial market," said Victoria Mitchell, analyst with Control Risks consultancy.

根据路透社审查的技术证据和安全研究人员的分析，去年，一个朝鲜黑客精英组织秘密入侵了俄罗斯一家主要导弹开发商的计算机网络至少五个月。

路透社发现，与朝鲜政府有联系的网络间谍团队（安全研究人员称之为 ScarCruft 和 Lazarus）秘密在 NPO Mashinostroyeniya 的系统中安装了隐形数字后门。NPO Mashinostroyeniya 是一家位于莫斯科郊区鲁托夫小镇的火箭设计局。

路透社无法确定入侵期间是否窃取了任何数据或可能查看了哪些信息。在数字入侵事件发生后的几个月里，平壤宣布了其被禁止的弹道导弹计划的几项进展，但尚不清楚这是否与此次入侵有关。

专家表示，这一事件表明，这个孤立的国家甚至会瞄准俄罗斯等盟友，以获取关键技术。

NPO Mashinostroyeniya 没有回应路透社的置评请求。俄罗斯驻华盛顿大使馆没有回复通过电子邮件发送的置评请求。朝鲜驻纽约联合国代表团没有回应置评请求。

俄罗斯国防部长谢尔盖·绍伊古上个月访问平壤参加朝鲜战争 70 周年纪念活动后不久，就传出了黑客攻击的消息。这是自1991年苏联解体以来俄罗斯国防部长首次访问朝鲜。

据导弹专家称，目标公司通常被称为 NPO Mash，是高超音速导弹、卫星技术和新一代弹道武器的先驱开发商——自朝鲜开始执行创建朝鲜核导弹的使命以来，朝鲜对这三个领域非常感兴趣。能够打击美国本土的洲际弹道导弹（ICBM）。

根据技术数据，此次入侵大致开始于 2021 年底，一直持续到 2022 年 5 月，根据路透社查阅的该公司内部通讯，IT 工程师检测到了黑客的活动。

NPO Mash 在冷战期间作为俄罗斯太空计划的主要卫星制造商和巡航导弹供应商而声名鹊起。

电子邮件黑客

美国网络安全公司 SentinelOne 的安全研究员 Tom Hegel 最初发现了这一漏洞，他表示，黑客深入公司的 IT 环境，使他们能够读取电子邮件流量、在网络之间跳转以及提取数据。

黑格尔说：“这些发现为秘密网络行动提供了罕见的洞察力，这些行动传统上一直隐藏在公众监督之外，或者根本不会被此类受害者发现。”

Hegel 的 SentinelOne 安全分析师团队发现一名 NPO Mash IT 员工在试图通过将证据上传到全球网络安全研究人员使用的私人门户网站来调查朝鲜攻击时意外泄露了公司的内部通信，从而得知了此次黑客攻击。

当路透社联系该 IT 人员时，该 IT 人员拒绝发表评论。

这一失误为路透社和 SentinelOne 提供了关于这家对俄罗斯国家至关重要的公司的独特快照，该公司在入侵克里米亚后受到奥巴马政府的制裁。

两位独立计算机安全专家尼古拉斯·韦弗和马特·泰特审查了暴露的电子邮件内容并确认了其真实性。分析师通过根据 NPO Mash 控制的一组密钥检查电子邮件的加密签名来验证连接。

“我对这些数据的真实性非常有信心，”韦弗告诉路透社。 “信息的曝光方式绝对是一次搞笑的搞砸”。

SentinelOne 表示，他们确信朝鲜是此次黑客攻击的幕后黑手，因为网络间谍重复使用了先前已知的恶意软件和恶意基础设施来实施其他入侵。

'电影的东西'

2019年，俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京称赞NPO马什公司的“锆石”高超音速导弹是“有前途的新产品”，其飞行速度约为音速的九倍。

研究朝鲜导弹计划外国援助的欧洲导弹专家马库斯·席勒表示，朝鲜黑客可能已经获得了有关锆石的信息，但这并不意味着他们会立即拥有同样的能力。

“那是电影里的东西，”他说。 “获得计划对你建造这些东西没有多大帮助，它比一些图纸要重要得多”。

然而，席勒补充说，鉴于 NPO Mash 作为俄罗斯顶级导弹设计商和生产商的地位，该公司将成为一个有价值的目标。

“有很多东西值得向他们学习，”他说。

专家表示，另一个令人感兴趣的领域可能是 NPO Mash 所使用的周围燃料的制造过程。上个月， 朝鲜试射了火星 18 号导弹，这是其首款使用固体推进剂的洲际弹道导弹。

这种加油方法可以在战争期间更快地部署导弹，因为它不需要在发射台上加油，从而使导弹在发射前更难跟踪和摧毁。

NPO Mash 生产了一种名为 SS-19 的洲际弹道导弹，该弹道导弹在工厂加注燃料并密封关闭，这一过程被称为“放大”，可产生类似的战略结果。

他说，教会的牧师必须以母亲的耐心和爱心陪伴所有人，包括那些不遵守规则的人。

教会教导女性不能成为牧师，因为耶稣只选择男性作为他的使徒。
